attributes.additional_details: The Speaker  of the House of Commons (or their deputy) should make sure that, when a question is put to the Prime Minister during the relevant session on Wednesdays, the Prime Minister actually answers the question (or commits to providing an answer at a future time if he is unable to provide an answer during the session) and is not able to make a pre-prepared statement that ignores the question or directs irrelevant criticism over a different matter back to to person that posed the question.
attributes.background: The Prime Minister should be required to answer all questions as put to him during PMQs.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament as a whole aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Order in the Commons is the responsibility of the Speaker personally, and the Prime Minister is responsible for answers to questions.
